2044.subject: SBS
2044.descrlong: Provides a scientific foundation for understanding how humans came to be the unusual, domineering, upright-walking, gentle-yet-ferocious, intelligent animals that we are. Examines evolutionary history, as well as the contributions of genetics, primate studies, osteology and paleoanthropology as unifying themes of biological/physical anthropology.

2054.subject: SBS
2054.descrlong: Examines the foundations of life through examination of the unifying themes of genetics, primate behavior, and paleoanthropology. Evolutionary theory, and theories of culture and archaeological methods demonstrate current scientific evidence for sixty million years of human biocultural evolution. Formerly known as SBSC 100.

2123.subject: SBS
2123.descrlong: Examines the foundations of life through examination of the unifying themes of genetics, primate behavior, and paleoanthropology. Evolutionary theory, and theories of culture and archaeological methods demonstrate current scientific evidence for sixty million years of human biocultural evolution.  Offered fall and spring semesters.

2124.subject: SBS
2124.descrlong: Students are introduced to science as a method of studying and understanding human biology from an evolutionary perspective. Examines the foundations of life and evolutionary theory and the principles of genetics, human adaptation, and primate behavior. Explores the fossil record of human biocultural evolution over the last sixty million years. Students will also consider the anthropological understanding of the concept of human "races" today.   (Credit/ No Credit Available)

2263.subject: SBS
2263.descrlong: Students are introduced to science as a method of studying and understanding human biology from an evolutionary perspective. Examines the foundations of life and evolutionary theory and the principles of genetics, human adaptation, and primate behavior. Explores the fossil record of human biocultural evolution over the last sixty million years. Students will also consider the anthropological understanding of the concept of human "races" today.
